result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan William Rickards

records.addlTxt:
1:30 PM Defendant Nathan William Rickards appeared by video from the Barron County Jail.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Nathan William Rickards.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews court record of information filed. Attny Taber acknowledges information, waives reading. Def Atty enters NG Plea. DEF agrees to NG to all counts, Court enters NG Plea to all counts. All parties agree to schedule, Court schedules.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:58 AM Court calls case and recites appearances. Commissioner Ward Winton appearing. Defendant Nathan William Rickards in court, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Nathan William Rickards.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin.  State calls Deputy Culhane. 12:00 PM Sworn/testifies. Direct by State. 12:01 PM Deputy Culhane identifies DE, Nathan Rickards. Direct conts. 12:03 PM State tenders witness. Cross by Atty Taber.  12:06 PM Nothing further from State.  12:06 PM No witnesses by DE.  12:06 PM Argument by State, argument by Atty Taber. Court finds probable cause, binds DE over for trial.  Atty Taber states have filed a motion for joinder in this case and case # 22CF66.  State has no objection. A dismissal will be filed in one of the cases by the State.  Arraignment set.
Arraignment scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

COMBINED BOND: 22CF66 & 22CF136
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:15 AM Court calls case and recites appearances. Defendant Nathan William Rickards appeared by video.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Nathan William Rickards.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. DE has not received copy of complaint. Atty Taber addresses Court re charges, Taber requests case 22CF66 be administratively dismissed and counts 1 & 2 be moved to case # 22CF136.
Atty Taber argues against bond in this case.  Court orders combined bond for both cases, current conditions.  Prelim set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
